required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Relationship Between Muscle Strength and Physical Function in ICU
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of the Relationship Between Muscle Strength and Physical Function in ICU Survivors

brief_summary.textblock: This observational study aims to assess the relationship between muscle strength and physical function in critical ill patients. Grip and quadriceps strengths are measured using a standardized protocol of dynamometry. Physical function is assessed using the validated ICU mobility scale.

primary_outcome.time_frame: as soon as collaborative during ICU stay and up to 1 month following ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Quadriceps maximal isometric strength measured using dynamometry

primary_outcome.time_frame: as soon as collaborative during ICU stay and up to 1 month following ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Grip maximal isometric strength measured using dynamometry

primary_outcome.time_frame: as soon as collaborative during ICU stay and up to 1 month following ICU discharge
primary_outcome.description: Ranking the patient on the scale according to his/her physical capacity. ICU mobility scale is a 10 points scale: 0 means the patient is lying in bed, 10 means the patient is able to walk independently

intervention.description: Using a handheld dynamometer, in supine position in a standardized position of the dominant leg Measurement of the maximal isometric voluntary quadriceps contraction Measure expressed as Newton and Newton/kg
Testing of dominant hand using a handgrip Measurement of the maximal isometric voluntary grip contraction Measure is expressed as kg
Scoring the physical capacity of the patient on a 10-points validated scale: the ICU mobility scale

study_pop.textblock: The study includes all critical ill patients staying in ICU for at least 48 hours. They are screened as soon as they are collaborative.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ICU stay of at least 48h
- Collaborative (RASS score -1 to +1)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal
- Coma
- Non collaborative
- Hemi / tetra paresis or plegia

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Clinic, Intensive Care Dpt
